meanings.sent1: The old books in the attic were slowly mouldering away.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house in the woods was mouldering with time.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich in the fridge was mouldering into a science experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of becoming a singer were mouldering like forgotten lyrics.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins stood as a testament to civilisations mouldering into history.

meanings.sent1: The mouldering leaves on the forest floor provided nutrients for new growth.
meanings.sent2: The damp cellar had a musty smell from the mouldering boxes.
meanings.sent3: The mouldering cheese in the fridge was avoided by everyone in the house.
meanings.sent4: The once grand castle now stood as a mouldering relic of the past.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned ship sat in the harbour, its hull mouldering from neglect.

meanings.definition: To crumble or break down gradually
meanings.sent1: The old stone wall was slowly mouldering into a pile of rubble.
meanings.sent2: The neglected garden shed was mouldering away in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten cake on the counter was mouldering into a mess of crumbs.
meanings.sent4: His trust in her was mouldering like a sandcastle in the tide.
meanings.sent5: The memories of their friendship were mouldering away with each passing year.
